channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Amber is only displayed for 2 seconds, 28th February
item.description:
The Amber traffic light only displays for 2 seconds which is much too quick for this 60mph road travelling on the A40 in direction from Northleach to Cheltenham. This causes heavy braking. Regulations state that Amber should be displayed for 3 seconds. This needs fixing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, Andoversford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars parking on zigzags outside school., 28th February
item.description:
This is todays example of inconsiderate parking outside Swindon Village Primary School. This was at after school club pick up time. Normal pickup time is bad too.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 16 Church Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
As pictures show sign has rotted at base and wind has bent across footpath.

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 27th February
item.description:
I believe a vehicle, a Renault master van reg number NX57EAJ, has been abandoned. It is untaxed and un-insured, has a cracked windscreen and has not been moved for many months. It is currently in a carpark in Wilson drive and is causing parking problems due to lack of parking spaces at times in the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 10 Wilson Drive, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor road conditions, 27th February
item.description:
The have been barriers on the road heading out of town for years due to the edge of the road subsiding. A benefit of this is that it became an unofficial cycle track. Separated from the road via the barriers. Unfortunately over time the cordon off area has become covered in mud and is now unrideable can this be cleared so that it can be used for its unintended purpose but a benefit to both riders and motorists ?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Larches Cirencester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pelican crossing Bath Road Cheltenham not working, 26th February
item.description:
The pelican crossing opposite 199 Bath Road Cheltenham is not working. No lights on either traffic or pedestrian facing lights and no response when button pressed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 199 Bath Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Dead Deer on Side of Road, 26th February
item.description:
The location is approx the mid point of Mill Lane. A small - fawn - carcase of a dead deer is on the side of the road. Please can it be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Glenfall Lodge Mill Lane, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuing issue with bin collections, 26th February
item.description:
Whoever is responsible for emptying the bins in the section highlighted and the two bins slightly further into the back of Charlton Park, simply doesn’t do their job. The reason that it got so bad when I reported it last time (with dog poo bins overflowing) is that a local resident (named Alistair) had gone on holiday and so hadn’t been emptying the bins and putting them by the bin by Moorend Road for easy collection by your staff. If you look at the photo attached, it’s not even being picked up from here now. Apparently it’s not been collected for two weeks now. Something needs to be done and to ensure regular pick up. The council should not be relying on a retired gentleman to do the work that an employee of yours is paid to do. Please rectify this situation.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Brook House Moorend Road, Charlton Park
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor road surface, 25th February
item.description:
